pygmy.handlers
Class BasicWebAuthHandler

java.lang.Object
  pygmy.core.AbstractHandler
      pygmy.handlers.BasicWebAuthHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Handler
public class BasicWebAuthHandler
extends AbstractHandler
implements Handler

This handler implements the Basic web authentication protocol outlined in RFC 2617. This handler sits in front of a set of a Handler to protect it from unauthorized access. If you need to protect several you can use DefaultChainHandler. Everything it's in front of will be protected.

This handler requires a file containing all of the known users. You can create a file by running this class' main(String[]) method.

Here is the syntax for running this class to create a password file:

java pgymy.handlers.BasicWebAuthHandler <file> <username> <password>

An existing file can be added to by calling this program again.

Constructor Detail

BasicWebAuthHandler

public BasicWebAuthHandler(java.lang.String realm,
                           java.io.File usersFile,
                           Handler delegate)
Creates a Handler that makes sure connections are authenticated before the delegate is allowed to process them.

Parameters:
realm - This is the realm reported to the client. See RFC 2617 for explanation of the realm parameter.
usersFile - This the path to a file containing all the users and their passwords allowed to access this url. To create a file you can run this class and hand it the file, username, and password to create. WARNING do not put this file in a place where it could be downloaded through this server.
delegate - the Handler you want to require authentication on.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
Use this method from the command line to create a user file.

Parameters:
args - the filename, username, and user's password.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if some IO error occurs in writing or reading this file.
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the JVM doesn't have the MD5 hash algorithm needed to create the file.
